alert.note: Alert for Bergen (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 02 at 7:37PM EDT until June 02 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by earlier excessive rainfall is occurring. * WHERE...Parts of central Bergen County in northeast New Jersey. * WHEN...Until 1030 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding of small streams and adjacent low lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 737 PM EDT, Gauge reports indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This is causing urban and small stream flooding. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Pascack Brook south of the Woodcliff Lake dam. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Westwood and Washington Township. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive through flooded areas.
